Package com.shelfsync.services

Class InventoryHistoryService

java.lang.Object
com.shelfsync.services.InventoryHistoryService
@Service public class InventoryHistoryService extends Object
Service for managing inventory transaction history.

Handles CRUD operations for inventory history records, which track all inventory movements (inbound, outbound, and transfers). This service automatically updates warehouse item quantities when history records are created, updated, or deleted.

Key business rules:

  • Creating a history record automatically applies quantity changes to warehouse items
  • Updating a history record reverses the old changes and applies the new changes
  • Deleting a history record reverses the quantity changes
  • All operations are transactional to ensure data consistency

Transaction types:

  • INBOUND: Items added to a warehouse (toWarehouse required, fromWarehouse null)
  • OUTBOUND: Items removed from a warehouse (fromWarehouse required, toWarehouse null)
  • TRANSFER: Items moved between warehouses (both fromWarehouse and toWarehouse required)

  • Constructor Details

    • InventoryHistoryService

      public InventoryHistoryService(InventoryHistoryRepository repo, ItemRepository itemRepo, WarehouseRepository warehouseRepo, EmployeeRepository employeeRepo, WarehouseItemService warehouseItemService)

  • Method Details

    • create

      public InventoryHistoryDto create(InventoryHistoryDto dto)
      Creates a new inventory history record and applies the quantity change to warehouse items.

      This method is transactional. When a history record is created, it automatically updates the corresponding warehouse item quantities through the WarehouseItemService. The quantity change is applied based on the transaction type (inbound, outbound, transfer).

      Parameters:
      dto - The inventory history data transfer object containing transaction details
      Returns:
      The created inventory history record
      Throws:
      ResourceNotFoundException - if the item, warehouse(s), or employee does not exist
      IllegalArgumentException - if the operation would violate business rules (handled by WarehouseItemService)

    • findAll

      public List<InventoryHistoryDto> findAll()
      Retrieves all inventory history records in the system.
      Returns:
      A list of all inventory history records

    • findById

      public InventoryHistoryDto findById(Integer id)
      Retrieves a specific inventory history record by its ID.
      Parameters:
      id - The inventory history ID
      Returns:
      The inventory history record
      Throws:
      ResourceNotFoundException - if the history record does not exist

    • findByWarehouseAndDateRange

      public List<InventoryHistoryDto> findByWarehouseAndDateRange(Integer warehouseId, OffsetDateTime start, OffsetDateTime end)
      Retrieves inventory history records for a specific warehouse within a date range.

      Returns all transactions (inbound, outbound, and transfers) that involve the specified warehouse, either as source or destination, within the given time period.

      Parameters:
      warehouseId - The warehouse ID (required)
      start - The start date/time of the range (inclusive)
      end - The end date/time of the range (inclusive)
      Returns:
      A list of inventory history records matching the criteria
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if warehouseId is null

    • findRecentActivities

      public List<InventoryHistoryDto> findRecentActivities()
      Retrieves the 10 most recent inventory history records.

      Useful for displaying recent activity across all warehouses. Records are ordered by occurrence date/time in descending order (most recent first).

      Returns:
      A list of the 10 most recent inventory history records

    • update

      public InventoryHistoryDto update(Integer id, InventoryHistoryDto dto)
      Updates an existing inventory history record and adjusts warehouse item quantities accordingly.

      This method is transactional and performs the following steps:

      1. Reverses the original quantity changes from warehouse items
      2. Updates the history record with new values
      3. Applies the new quantity changes to warehouse items

      This ensures that warehouse item quantities remain consistent with the history record.

      Parameters:
      id - The inventory history ID
      dto - The inventory history data transfer object with updated transaction details
      Returns:
      The updated inventory history record
      Throws:
      ResourceNotFoundException - if the history record, item, warehouse(s), or employee does not exist
      IllegalArgumentException - if the operation would violate business rules (handled by WarehouseItemService)

    • deleteById

      public void deleteById(Integer id)
      Deletes an inventory history record and reverses the quantity changes from warehouse items.

      This method is transactional. When a history record is deleted, it automatically reverses the quantity changes that were applied when the record was created. This ensures that warehouse item quantities remain accurate.

      Parameters:
      id - The inventory history ID to delete
      Throws:
      ResourceNotFoundException - if the history record does not exist
